attributes.action: Ask the N.I Executive to give scientific evidence to support restrictions
attributes.additional_details: The public has been left in the dark with the new restrictions, particularly as the restrictions do not seem to match the scientific evidence. In the 'evidence bank' from the Executive following harsh restrictions on the hospitality sector during the circuit breaker, it showed that the closure of the hospitality sector (bars etc.) would only have a 'moderate impact' on the R number but will have a 'high direct impact' on people due to loss of income. The public needs an explanation.
attributes.background: Westminster should ask the Northern Ireland Executive to give scientific evidence from officials with a rationale to back up any new lockdown restrictions.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for the Northern Ireland Assembly.

If you'd like to send your petition to the Northern Ireland Assembly, you can find the contact details here:
http://www.niassembly.gov.uk/about-the-assembly/contact-us/

If you want to raise this issue you could contact your MLA. You can find contact details for your MLAs here: http://www.niassembly.gov.uk/your-mlas/
